lead_paragraph: Speaker Paul D. Ryan may be forced to acquiesce to Donald Trump in the name of Republican unity or establish himself as the party’s leading voice of opposition.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and JONATHAN MARTIN

headline.main: Ryan Caught Between Desire for Republican Unity and Future Agenda

snippet: Speaker Paul D. Ryan may be forced to acquiesce to Donald Trump in the name of Republican unity or establish himself as the party’s leading voice of opposition.
abstract: House Speaker Paul Ryan, who has so far been reluctant to declare his support for presumptive presidential nominee Donald Trump, will enter coming meeting with Trump at odds with growing Republican congressional majority that has accepted Trump as its candidate; Ryan's decision about whether to support Trump or not will have long-term consequences both for his own career and for party.
